org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.modellibs.core.transformations

Class FlattenInteractionComponents

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.papyrus.designer.components.modellibs.core.transformations.FlattenInteractionComponents
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IM2MTrafoElem, IM2MTrafo

    public class FlattenInteractionComponents
extends Object
implements IM2MTrafoElem
    Flatten interaction components for distributed communication, i.e. remove the enclosing interaction component and only deploy the fragments. This is required, since the interaction component itself cannot be deployed on several nodes.

    • Method Detail

      • flattenAssembly

        public void flattenAssembly(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Class composite,
                            org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification instance,
                            org.eclipse.uml2.uml.InstanceSpecification containingInstance,
                            org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Slot containingSlot)
        Flatten a composite interaction component, i.e. replace it by the containing fragments. This includes the following actions 1. Parts typed with the interaction component must be replaced with a set of parts typed with the fragment. 2. Connectors must be redirected. Please note that we do not delete the original interaction component, but it will not appear in a model generated for a specific node. TODO: We need to re-target connectors in all containing composites, but the same containingComposite might have several instances within an application. In this case, we only need to move slots. Well, there are different classes: first: the flattened interaction component and other components that reference the flattened interaction component.
        Parameters:
        composite - a composite class
        instance - the instance associated with the composite class (1st parameter)
        containingInstance - an instance of the containing composite
        containingSlot - the slot associated with the instance (2nd parameter)

      • retargetConnections

                                org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Property subPart)
        Find a connection within a connecting
        Parameters:
        containingComposite -
        port - A port which delegates to a fragment
        part - the part within the containing composite (1st parameter) point to the interactionComponent
        subPart - a newly created part corresponding to the fragment
